documentation.text:
This is a generic factory contract that can be used to mint tokens. The configuration
 for minting is specified by an _optionId, which can be used to delineate various
 ways of minting.
Returns the name of this factory.
Returns the symbol for this factory.
Number of options the factory supports.

Returns whether the option ID can be minted. Can return false if the developer wishes to
 restrict a total supply per option ID (or overall).

Returns a URL specifying some metadata about the option. This metadata can be of the
 same structure as the ERC1155 metadata.
Indicates that this is a factory contract. Ideally would use EIP 165 supportsInterface()
Indicates the Wyvern schema name for assets in this lootbox, e.g. "ERC1155"

attributes.text:
This is a generic factory contract that can be used to mint tokens. The configuration
 for minting is specified by an _optionId, which can be used to delineate various
 ways of minting.
Returns the name of this factory.
Returns the symbol for this factory.
Number of options the factory supports.

Returns whether the option ID can be minted. Can return false if the developer wishes to
 restrict a total supply per option ID (or overall).

Returns a URL specifying some metadata about the option. This metadata can be of the
 same structure as the ERC1155 metadata.
Indicates that this is a factory contract. Ideally would use EIP 165 supportsInterface()
Indicates the Wyvern schema name for assets in this lootbox, e.g. "ERC1155"

mint(uint256,address,uint256,bytes).details: Mints asset(s) in accordance to a specific address with a particular "option". This should be callable only by the contract owner or the owner's Wyvern Proxy (later universal login will solve this). Options should also be delineated 0 - (numOptions() - 1) for convenient indexing.

params._amount: amount of the option to mint
params._data: Extra data to pass during safeTransferFrom
params._toAddress: address of the future owner of the asset(s)

canMint(uint256,uint256).notice: Returns whether the option ID can be minted. Can return false if the developer wishes to restrict a total supply per option ID (or overall).

factorySchemaName().notice: Indicates the Wyvern schema name for assets in this lootbox, e.g. "ERC1155"

name().notice: Returns the name of this factory.

numOptions().notice: Number of options the factory supports.

supportsFactoryInterface().notice: Indicates that this is a factory contract. Ideally would use EIP 165 supportsInterface()

symbol().notice: Returns the symbol for this factory.

uri(uint256).notice: Returns a URL specifying some metadata about the option. This metadata can be of the same structure as the ERC1155 metadata.

userdoc.notice: This is a generic factory contract that can be used to mint tokens. The configuration for minting is specified by an _optionId, which can be used to delineate various ways of minting.
